website_summaries.verdict: Customers who do not have full use of both arms thanks to stroke or amputation should try this aid – it allows for single-handed use.
pros: Flexible plastic sock aid lined with nylon fabric on the inside that allows the foot to "slide" into the sock
Terrycloth outer cover provides a non-slip resistance
Works for everything from thick socks to hosiery
cons: Top stitching can come unraveled relatively easily

customer_reviews.title: Works For Me
customer_reviews.text: It's satin on inside -- foot slides in easily, and terry on outside -- holds onto sock til you pull it out. Long straps work well. You do need two good hands to get the sock onto it, and have to have some reasonable control of your legs, to get your toes into the sock. You do need to b end over and pull the sock up, situate it properly etc. I am fat and have arthritis in my knees, so I simply can't reach my feet to put my socks on. This item works well for me, but a more disabled person might need a different solution. The plastic is flexible, so it doesn't stretch your socks out.
customer_reviews.author: Ember Rose Baker

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Used once and came apart. I purchased one of these in 2015 from this same company and it was very well unlike this one witch when I tried it one of the straps just came apart. The quality of this sock assist is terrible ,was only sewn to the light weight fabric compared to the one in 2015 that was sewn through both fabrics and the plastic. I was refunded promptly .I DO NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: is a great as it is very painful to bend
customer_reviews.text: Waiting for a hip replacement this Terry covered Sock.. is a great as it is very painful to bend. It is easy to use and easily washable. I have not tried it with panty hose yet but as am hoping that it will be, just as easy to use. Wonderful idea - thank you very much to the Person who 'invented it'
customer_reviews.author: Valerie G. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this particular sock aid because of a comment from another review. He said the terry backing holds your sock in place better than the slick plastic kind. Well, he was right. I use this almost everyday. I am four weeks post Mini THR and can do everything else without help but just a little afraid of bending that leg so far up. Works perfectly every time and the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. Easier to use for sneakers low cut socks that do not fit on my other sock aid and cheaper too.. I now actually use it for all socks.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT! Got this for my Father
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT ! Got this for my Father, he loves it ! I had tried a few in the stores, but this one really worked. My Father is 84 and can not bend over well even if he is sitting. I have watched and helped him get his socks on. This particular item works the best and is EASY TO USE for the elderly !! Try it, you will not be disappointed !
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Love it !!! Best sock aid we have ever tried.
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this sock aid. The sock goes over the device and slips onto his foot easily.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Boldt

customer_reviews.title: Works great but......
customer_reviews.text: It works great but after two weeks the fabric has come unstitched just like the other reviews said that it would. I thought they would have made an improvement buy now
customer_reviews.author: JOM

customer_reviews.title: Better than any other sock donner that I have tried
customer_reviews.text: This is the most convenient sock donner that I have tried. In fact, it is the second one that I own. I bought this one to keep in my favorite suitcase so I won't forget to pack this necessary aid when I travel.

customer_reviews.title: Great people!
customer_reviews.text: Great. Just what I wanted and at a great price. I will be back. Thanks!

customer_reviews.title: IT DOES ITS JOB!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a miracle for those of us who experience difficulty in pulling on socks. It could be a little better stitched, but it works wonderfully. I whole-heartedly recommend it to all who need help pulling on socks.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Louise

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: With very little use the cover ripped and came off. I purchased this in anticipation of my current sock aid wearing out after many years of use.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and much better than the ones with stick handles - allows for more flexibilty
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this to the sock aids that use a stick handle. I have more options to maneuver the aid onto my foot and leg and with my swelling, these cloth aids don't restrict my feet and legs as I put my socks on.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lou

customer_reviews.title: Failed Almost Immediately - Weak Attachment of Pull Tapes
customer_reviews.text: Lasted almost through 2 pair of socks. Then the tape broke. Going to try to sew it back together but I suspect it will simply fail again.

customer_reviews.title: A god Send
customer_reviews.text: Prior to getting this sock aid I could not put my socks on and now it is a snap. I absolutely love it.

customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a friend who was having hip surgery. She used it after surgery and said it worked great. Would recommend.

Perhaps I am using it wrongly; however, the instructions provided with the device were too vague to be helpful. The device did not meet my expectations.

customer_reviews.text: For the most part it works fine, but if the socks are tight, the threads on the pull straps break and I'm afraid the straps won't hold up well.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well but it is a little stifF. I'm sure Ira will work better as it gets used more.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Miller

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly simple, works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: My hip does not allow me to easily reach my foot. So, this makes it easier than putting socks on the foot with the good hip. It works for shoe-top (short) socks as well as longer socks, even those with little stretch to them. If it's not clear how it works, it's very simple. The three "prongs" go into the sock top. The plastic on the inside is flexible but stiff enough that it holds the sock open. The fleece on the outside helps keep the sock from slipping. Insert your foot while holding the straps, and it just slides right into the sock in one motion. Now .... to get that sock back off ....
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I can wear socks again!
customer_reviews.text: This simple device has been a life saver. Back problems have made it impossible to bend over to reach my feet. This very simple product makes it very easy to wear socks again. I can see where those complaints about it not being usable on a compression sock would valid. I use it to pull on my soft-sided, high top slippers, and to pull on tube socks. It sort of turns the sock into a boot, making the sides stiff so you can then slip your foot in and pull the sock up.
customer_reviews.author: ValleyGirlGrownUp

customer_reviews.title: Prefer the plastic tube type better
customer_reviews.text: I got this after hip replacement surgery. I bought this type because it folds and you can pack it easily in a suitcase. My friend also had surgery and bought the plastic tube type one and I like hers better just because it's easier to use. But this one is ok and works fine - it's just a little bulky and harder to use. It appears to be very well made and does pack flat. It's just harder to get a sock around this one as it's not slick like a plastic one.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly but take s just a little practice
customer_reviews.text: I purchased prior to hip replacement surgery as it was recommended by my physical therapist. Glad I had some time to practice before surgery. Works great putting on socks while staying within my hip precautions after surgery.
customer_reviews.author: stm0041

customer_reviews.title: This Sock Aid is nothing short of Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This device is wonderful! Arthritis limits my movements, but I can always put on my socks. A recent leg injury required me to wear a compression binding on my leg. I easily put it on by folding the ends back and slipping it on my leg then unfolding the ends. I have two of these sock aids just in case I misplace one temporarily. It is one of the most helpful tools I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: E. G.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Gave it as a gift, she had difficulty learning, but once I demonstrated she could not live without!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Putney

customer_reviews.title: Handy invention!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. When I got out of hospital I gave mine away, thinking I wouldn't need it. Don't make that mistake! Put it in drawer. If you need it once, you will need it again at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Joy J.

customer_reviews.title: Works up to a point
customer_reviews.text: This is helpful for putting on socks when bending to the foot is not possible. It works for loose socks to get the sock around the heel, but not for tight ones or support hose as the tube part compresses too much under the tension of the sock/hose so that one can't get one's foot into the toe. Even with looser socks you'll probably need to use a grabber as well to pull up calf-length socks all the way. I used it after total hip replacement for a while, but found that I could do almost as well with the grabber alone.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for someone else and he loves it. Says it is better then the other two he had. It does appear better made then others I have seen. Good for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great but requires pretty strong hands to make it work. You kind of " bend into a tube",then stick foot in. I used after hip.replacement.

He described this product to me and I located it on Amazon. He uses it everyday . . . such a help when I'm not around to help.

product_meta.title: Kinsman Enterprises 32016 Terry Covered Sock Aid
product_meta.description:
A flexible plastic sock aid that is lined with nylon fabric on the inside that allows the foot to "slide" into the sock. Terry cloth outer cover provides a non-slip resistance to the sock which helps prevent the sock from slipping off the sock aid before it's snug. Strap handles. One-handed use is possible with this sock aid.

MANUFACTURER CONTACT INFORMATION
Not Applicable
